newsitem.title: USA: Carolina Brunswick, N.C. nuke at full power.
newsitem.headline: Carolina Brunswick, N.C. nuke at full power.

text.p: Carolina Power & Light Co's 754 megawatt Brunswick nuclear power unit 2 in Southport, N.C. was operating at full power Thursday, back from a cut in output which began last weekend, Nuclear Regulatory Commission said.
Brunswick 2 was reduced to about 60 percent of capacity while repairs were made to one of the unit's feedwater pumps.
The unit had returned to 100 percent capacity as of early Thursday morning, the NRC said in its daily plant status report.
The company's 767 megawatt Brunswick unit 1, at the same Southport site, was reducing power as it heads into a 35-day refueling and maintenance outage scheduled to begin October 5.
Brunswick 1 was operating at 90 percent of capacity as of early Thursday, the NRC said.
